verses.verse: Διοδεύσαντες <WG1353> Diodeusantes they had passed through ( The Uproar in Thessalonica) δὲ <WG1161> de [When] τὴν <WG3588> tēn - Ἀμφίπολιν <WG295> Amphipolin Amphipolis καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὴν <WG3588> tēn - Ἀπολλωνίαν <WG624> Apollōnian Apollonia , ἦλθον <WG2064> ēlthon they came εἰς <WG1519> eis to Θεσσαλονίκην <WG2332> Thessalonikēn Thessalonica , ὅπου <WG3699> hopou where ἦν <WG1510> ēn there was συναγωγὴ <WG4864> synagōgē synagogue . τῶν <WG3588> tōn vvv Ἰουδαίων <WG2453> Ioudaiōn a Jewish

κατὰ <WG2596> kata As was δὲ <WG1161> de - τὸ <WG3588> to [his] εἰωθὸς <WG1486> eiōthos custom , τῷ <WG3588> tō - Παύλῳ <WG3972> Paulō Paul εἰσῆλθεν <WG1525> eisēlthen went into πρὸς <WG4314> pros . . . αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous [the synagogue] , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi on σάββατα <WG4521> sabbata Sabbaths τρία <WG5140> tria three διελέξατο <WG1256> dielexato he reasoned αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois with them ἀπὸ <WG575> apo from τῶν <WG3588> tōn the γραφῶν <WG1124> graphōn Scriptures ,

διανοίγων <WG1272> dianoigōn explaining καὶ <WG2532> kai and παρατιθέμενος <WG3908> paratithemenos proving ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that τὸν <WG3588> ton the Χριστὸν <WG5547> Christon Christ ἔδει <WG1163> edei had to παθεῖν <WG3958> pathein suffer καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀναστῆναι <WG450> anastēnai rise ἐκ <WG1537> ek from νεκρῶν <WG3498> nekrōn [the] dead . καὶ <WG2532> kai - ὅτι <WG3754> hoti [ he declared ] . Οὗτός <WG3778> Houtos “ This ἐστιν <WG1510> estin is ὁ <WG3588> ho the Χριστός <WG5547> Christos Christ , ” ὁ <WG3588> ho - Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus ὃν <WG3739> hon - ἐγὼ <WG1473> egō I καταγγέλλω <WG2605> katangellō am proclaiming ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin to you

καί <WG2532> kai - τινες <WG5100> tines Some ἐξ <WG1537> ex of αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn [the Jews] ἐπείσθησαν <WG3982> epeisthēsan were persuaded καὶ <WG2532> kai and προσεκληρώθησαν <WG4345> proseklērōthēsan joined τῷ <WG3588> tō - Παύλῳ <WG3972> Paulō Paul καὶ <WG2532> kai and τῷ <WG3588> tō - Σιλᾷ <WG4609> Sila Silas , τῶν <WG3588> tōn of τε <WG5037> te along with σεβομένων <WG4576> sebomenōn God-fearing Ἑλλήνων <WG1672> Hellēnōn Greeks πλῆθος <WG4128> plēthos number πολὺ <WG4183> poly a large γυναικῶν <WG1135> gynaikōn women . τε <WG5037> te and τῶν <WG3588> tōn - πρώτων <WG4413> prōtōn leading οὐκ <WG3756> ouk [quite] ὀλίγαι <WG3641> oligai a few

Ζηλώσαντες <WG2206> Zēlōsantes became jealous . δὲ <WG1161> de however , οἱ <WG3588> hoi The Ἰουδαῖοι <WG2453> Ioudaioi Jews , καὶ <WG2532> kai [So] προσλαβόμενοι <WG4355> proslabomenoi they brought in τῶν <WG3588> tōn from the ἀγοραίων <WG60> agoraiōn marketplace , ἄνδρας <WG435> andras . . . τινὰς <WG5100> tinas some πονηροὺς <WG4190> ponērous troublemakers καὶ <WG2532> kai - ὀχλοποιήσαντες <WG3792> ochlopoiēsantes formed a mob , ἐθορύβουν <WG2350> ethoryboun [and] sent the city into an uproar τὴν <WG3588> tēn . . . πόλιν <WG4172> polin . . . . καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐπιστάντες <WG2186> epistantes They raided τῇ <WG3588> tē - οἰκίᾳ <WG3614> oikia house Ἰάσονος <WG2394> Iasonos Jason’s ἐζήτουν <WG2212> ezētoun in search of αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous [Paul and Silas] , προαγαγεῖν <WG4254> proagagein [hoping] to bring them out εἰς <WG1519> eis to τὸν <WG3588> ton the δῆμον <WG1218> dēmon people .

μὴ <WG3361> mē vvv εὑρόντες <WG2147> heurontes they could not find δὲ <WG1161> de But when αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous them , ἔσυρον <WG4951> esyron they dragged Ἰάσονα <WG2394> Iasona Jason καί <WG2532> kai and τινας <WG5100> tinas some other ἀδελφοὺς <WG80> adelphous brothers ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi before τοὺς <WG3588> tous the πολιτάρχας <WG4173> politarchas city officials , βοῶντες <WG994> boōntes shouting ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - , Οἱ <WG3588> Hoi who τὴν <WG3588> tēn vvv οἰκουμένην <WG3625> oikoumenēn the world upside down ἀναστατώσαντες <WG387> anastatōsantes have turned οὗτοι <WG3778> houtoi “ These [men] καὶ <WG2532> kai . . . ἐνθάδε <WG1759> enthade here , πάρεισιν <WG3918> pareisin have now come

οὓς <WG3739> hous . . . . ὑποδέδεκται <WG5264> hypodedektai has welcomed them into his home Ἰάσων <WG2394> Iasōn [and] Jason καὶ <WG2532> kai - οὗτοι <WG3778> houtoi They πάντες <WG3956> pantes are all ἀπέναντι <WG561> apenanti . . . τῶν <WG3588> tōn - δογμάτων <WG1378> dogmatōn decrees , Καίσαρος <WG2541> Kaisaros Caesar’s πράσσουσι* <WG4238> prassousi defying βασιλέα <WG935> basilea king , ἕτερον <WG2087> heteron another λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes saying that εἶναι <WG1510> einai there is Ἰησοῦν <WG2424> Iēsoun [ named ] Jesus ! ”

Ἐτάραξαν <WG5015> Etaraxan were greatly disturbed . δὲ <WG1161> de - τὸν <WG3588> ton the ὄχλον <WG3793> ochlon crowd καὶ <WG2532> kai and τοὺς <WG3588> tous - πολιτάρχας <WG4173> politarchas city officials ἀκούοντας <WG191> akouontas On hearing ταῦτα <WG3778> tauta this ,

καὶ <WG2532> kai And λαβόντες <WG2983> labontes they collected τὸ <WG3588> to - ἱκανὸν <WG2425> hikanon bond παρὰ <WG3844> para from τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Ἰάσονος <WG2394> Iasonos Jason καὶ <WG2532> kai and τῶν <WG3588> tōn the λοιπῶν <WG3062> loipōn others , ἀπέλυσαν <WG630> apelysan [and then] released αὐτούς <WG846> autous them .

Οἱ <WG3588> Hoi the ( The Character of the Bereans) δὲ <WG1161> de - ἀδελφοὶ <WG80> adelphoi brothers εὐθέως <WG2112> eutheōs As soon as διὰ <WG1223> dia - νυκτὸς <WG3571> nyktos night [had fallen] , ἐξέπεμψαν <WG1599> exepempsan sent τόν <WG3588> ton - τε <WG5037> te - Παῦλον <WG3972> Paulon Paul καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὸν <WG3588> ton - Σιλᾶν <WG4609> Silan Silas εἰς <WG1519> eis away to Βέροιαν <WG960> Beroian Berea . οἵτινες <WG3748> hoitines - παραγενόμενοι <WG3854> paragenomenoi On arriving [there] , εἰς <WG1519> eis into τὴν <WG3588> tēn the συναγωγὴν <WG4864> synagōgēn synagogue . τῶν <WG3588> tōn - Ἰουδαίων <WG2453> Ioudaiōn Jewish ἀπῄεσαν <WG549> apēesan they went

οὗτοι <WG3778> houtoi [the Bereans] δὲ <WG1161> de Now ἦσαν <WG1510> ēsan were εὐγενέστεροι <WG2104> eugenesteroi more noble-minded τῶν <WG3588> tōn than the ἐν <WG1722> en vvv Θεσσαλονίκῃ <WG2332> Thessalonikē Thessalonians , οἵτινες <WG3748> hoitines [for] ἐδέξαντο <WG1209> edexanto they received τὸν <WG3588> ton the λόγον <WG3056> logon message μετὰ <WG3326> meta with πάσης <WG3956> pasēs great προθυμίας <WG4288> prothymias eagerness τὸ <WG3588> to vvv καθ’ <WG2596> kath’ every ἡμέραν <WG2250> hēmeran day ἀνακρίνοντες <WG350> anakrinontes [and] examined τὰς <WG3588> tas the γραφὰς <WG1124> graphas Scriptures εἰ <WG1487> ei [to see] if ἔχοι <WG2192> echoi were ταῦτα <WG3778> tauta these [teachings] οὕτως <WG3779> houtōs true . ( Literally with great eagerness, every day examining the Writings, whether these things were so.)

πολλοὶ <WG4183> polloi many μὲν <WG3303> men - οὖν <WG3767> oun As a result , ἐξ <WG1537> ex of αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn them ἐπίστευσαν <WG4100> episteusan believed , καὶ <WG2532> kai along with τῶν <WG3588> tōn - Ἑλληνίδων <WG1674> Hellēnidōn Greek γυναικῶν <WG1135> gynaikōn women τῶν <WG3588> tōn - εὐσχημόνων <WG2158> euschēmonōn prominent καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀνδρῶν <WG435> andrōn men . οὐκ <WG3756> ouk [quite] ὀλίγοι <WG3641> oligoi a few

Ὡς <WG5613> Hōs when δὲ <WG1161> de But ἔγνωσαν <WG1097> egnōsan learned οἱ <WG3588> hoi the ἀπὸ <WG575> apo from τῆς <WG3588> tēs - Θεσσαλονίκης <WG2332> Thessalonikēs Thessalonica Ἰουδαῖοι <WG2453> Ioudaioi Jews ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that καὶ <WG2532> kai vvv ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē - Βεροίᾳ <WG960> Beroia Berea , κατηγγέλη <WG2605> katēngelē was also proclaiming ὑπὸ <WG5259> hypo - τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Παύλου <WG3972> Paulou Paul ὁ <WG3588> ho the λόγος <WG3056> logos word τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou of God ἦλθον <WG2064> ēlthon they went κἀκεῖ <WG2546> kakei there themselves σαλεύοντες <WG4531> saleuontes to incite καὶ <WG2532> kai and ταράσσοντες <WG5015> tarassontes agitate τοὺς <WG3588> tous the ὄχλους <WG3793> ochlous crowds .

εὐθέως <WG2112> eutheōs immediately δὲ <WG1161> de - τότε <WG5119> tote vvv τὸν <WG3588> ton - Παῦλον <WG3972> Paulon Paul ἐξαπέστειλαν <WG1821> exapesteilan sent οἱ <WG3588> hoi The ἀδελφοὶ <WG80> adelphoi brothers πορεύεσθαι <WG4198> poreuesthai to ἕως <WG2193> heōs - ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi - τὴν <WG3588> tēn the θάλασσαν <WG2281> thalassan [coast] , ὑπέμεινάν <WG5278> hypemeinan remained τε <WG5037> te [but] ὅ <WG3588> ho - τε <WG5037> te - Σιλᾶς <WG4609> Silas Silas καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho - Τιμόθεος <WG5095> Timotheos Timothy ἐκεῖ <WG1563> ekei [in Berea] .

οἱ <WG3588> hoi Those who δὲ <WG1161> de - καθιστάνοντες <WG2525> kathistanontes escorted τὸν <WG3588> ton - Παῦλον <WG3972> Paulon Paul ἤγαγον <WG71> ēgagon brought [him] ἕως <WG2193> heōs to Ἀθηνῶν <WG116> Athēnōn Athens καὶ <WG2532> kai and then λαβόντες <WG2983> labontes with ἐντολὴν <WG1785> entolēn instructions πρὸς <WG4314> pros for τὸν <WG3588> ton - Σιλᾶν <WG4609> Silan Silas καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὸν <WG3588> ton - Τιμόθεον <WG5095> Timotheon Timothy ἵνα <WG2443> hina to ὡς <WG5613> hōs as τάχιστα <WG5033> tachista soon as possible . ἔλθωσιν <WG2064> elthōsin [join] πρὸς <WG4314> pros . . . αὐτὸν <WG846> auton him ἐξῄεσαν <WG1826> exēesan [returned]

Ἐν <WG1722> En in ( Paul in Athens) δὲ <WG1161> de [While] ταῖς <WG3588> tais - Ἀθήναις <WG116> Athēnais Athens , ἐκδεχομένου <WG1551> ekdechomenou was waiting for αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous them τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Παύλου <WG3972> Paulou Paul παρωξύνετο <WG3947> parōxyneto he was deeply disturbed τὸ <WG3588> to - πνεῦμα <WG4151> pneuma spirit αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his ἐν <WG1722> en in αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - θεωροῦντος <WG2334> theōrountos to see that κατείδωλον <WG2712> kateidōlon full of idols . οὖσαν <WG1510> ousan was τὴν <WG3588> tēn the πόλιν <WG4172> polin city

διελέγετο <WG1256> dielegeto he reasoned μὲν <WG3303> men - οὖν <WG3767> oun So ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē the συναγωγῇ <WG4864> synagōgē synagogue τοῖς <WG3588> tois with the Ἰουδαίοις <WG2453> Ioudaiois Jews καὶ <WG2532> kai and τοῖς <WG3588> tois - σεβομένοις <WG4576> sebomenois God-fearing [Gentiles] , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē the ἀγορᾷ <WG58> agora marketplace κατὰ <WG2596> kata vvv πᾶσαν <WG3956> pasan each ἡμέραν <WG2250> hēmeran day . πρὸς <WG4314> pros with τοὺς <WG3588> tous those παρατυγχάνοντας <WG3909> paratynchanontas he met

Τινὲς <WG5100> Tines Some δὲ <WG1161> de - καὶ <WG2532> kai also τῶν <WG3588> tōn - Ἐπικουρείων* <WG1946> Epikoureiōn Epicurean καὶ <WG2532> kai and Στοϊκῶν <WG4770> Stoikōn Stoic φιλοσόφων <WG5386> philosophōn philosophers συνέβαλλον <WG4820> syneballon began to debate αὐτῷ <WG846> autō with him . καί <WG2532> kai - τινες <WG5100> tines Some [of them] ἔλεγον <WG2036> elegon asked , Τί <WG5101> Ti “ What ἂν <WG302> an . . . θέλοι <WG2309> theloi trying ὁ <WG3588> ho - σπερμολόγος <WG4691> spermologos babbler οὗτος <WG3778> houtos is this λέγειν <WG3004> legein to say ? ” οἱ <WG3588> hoi Others [said] , δέ <WG1161> de - Ξένων <WG3581> Xenōn foreign δαιμονίων <WG1140> daimoniōn gods . ” δοκεῖ <WG1380> dokei “ He seems καταγγελεὺς <WG2604> katangeleus advocating εἶναι <WG1510> einai to be ὅτι <WG3754> hoti [They said this] because τὸν <WG3588> ton - Ἰησοῦν <WG2424> Iēsoun of Jesus καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ἀνάστασιν <WG386> anastasin resurrection . εὐηγγελίζετο <WG2097> euēngelizeto [Paul] was proclaiming the good news

Ἐπιλαβόμενοί <WG1949> Epilabomenoi they took τε* <WG5037> te So αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou [Paul] ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi to τὸν <WG3588> ton the Ἄρειον <WG697> Areion Areopagus πάγον <WG697> pagon . . . , ( Or Ares Hill or Mars Hill; also in verse 22 and added for clarity in verse 33) ἤγαγον <WG71> ēgagon [and] brought [him] λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes [where] they asked [him] , Δυνάμεθα <WG1410> Dynametha “ May we γνῶναι <WG1097> gnōnai know τίς <WG5101> tis what ἡ <WG3588> hē - καινὴ <WG2537> kainē new αὕτη <WG3778> hautē this ἡ <WG3588> hē - ὑπὸ <WG5259> hypo vvv σοῦ <WG4771> sou [that] you λαλουμένη <WG2980> laloumenē are presenting ? διδαχή <WG1322> didachē teaching [is]

ξενίζοντα <WG3579> xenizonta strange notions γάρ <WG1063> gar For τινα <WG5100> tina some εἰσφέρεις <WG1533> eisphereis you are bringing εἰς <WG1519> eis to τὰς <WG3588> tas - ἀκοὰς <WG189> akoas ears , ἡμῶν <WG1473> hēmōn our βουλόμεθα <WG1014> boulometha we want οὖν <WG3767> oun [and] γνῶναι <WG1097> gnōnai to know τίνα <WG5101> tina what θέλει <WG2309> thelei mean ταῦτα <WG3778> tauta [they] εἶναι <WG1510> einai . . . . ”

Ἀθηναῖοι <WG117> Athēnaioi [the] Athenians δὲ <WG1161> de Now πάντες <WG3956> pantes all καὶ <WG2532> kai and οἱ <WG3588> hoi - ἐπιδημοῦντες <WG1927> epidēmountes who lived there ξένοι <WG3581> xenoi foreigners εἰς <WG1519> eis [doing] οὐδὲν <WG3762> ouden nothing ἕτερον <WG2087> heteron [more] ηὐκαίρουν <WG2119> ēukairoun spent their time ἢ <WG2228> ē than λέγειν <WG3004> legein articulating τι <WG5100> ti - ἢ <WG2228> ē and ἀκούειν <WG191> akouein hearing τι <WG5100> ti - καινότερον <WG2537> kainoteron new [ideas] .

Σταθεὶς <WG2476> Statheis stood up ( Paul’s Address in the Areopagus) δὲ <WG1161> de Then [ὁ] <WG3588> ho - Παῦλος <WG3972> Paulos Paul ἐν <WG1722> en in μέσῳ <WG3319> mesō [the] meeting ( Literally in the middle) τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the Ἀρείου <WG697> Areiou Areopagus Πάγου <WG697> Pagou . . . ἔφη <WG5346> ephē [and] said , Ἄνδρες <WG435> Andres “ Men Ἀθηναῖοι <WG117> Athēnaioi [of] Athens , κατὰ <WG2596> kata in πάντα <WG3956> panta every way ὡς <WG5613> hōs that δεισιδαιμονεστέρους <WG1174> deisidaimonesterous very religious . ὑμᾶς <WG4771> hymas you [are] θεωρῶ <WG2334> theōrō I see

διερχόμενος <WG1330> dierchomenos as I walked around γὰρ <WG1063> gar For καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀναθεωρῶν <WG333> anatheōrōn examined τὰ <WG3588> ta - σεβάσματα <WG4574> sebasmata objects of worship , ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn your εὗρον <WG2147> heuron I even found καὶ <WG2532> kai . . . βωμὸν <WG1041> bōmon an altar ἐν <WG1722> en vvv ᾧ <WG3739> hō with ἐπεγέγραπτο <WG1924> epegegrapto this inscription : ΑΓΝΩΣΤΩ <WG57> AGNŌSTŌ TO AN UNKNOWN ΘΕΩ <WG2316> THEŌ GOD . Ὃ <WG3739> Ho what οὖν <WG3767> oun Therefore ἀγνοοῦντες <WG50> agnoountes as something unknown , εὐσεβεῖτε <WG2151> eusebeite you worship τοῦτο <WG3778> touto - ἐγὼ <WG1473> egō I καταγγέλλω <WG2605> katangellō [now] proclaim ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin to you .
